entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 11:07AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS COMBINED WITH FALLING SNOW ALONG THE ALASKA PENINSULA ON SATURDAY... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 11:24AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Extended Arctic Cold Snap Coming.... Arctic air will soon begin spreading into the region as we head into the holiday weekend. This will eventually help change rain over to some brief light snow in some places just before it ends, and it will offer sub freezing air for any moisture that lingers despite the wind`s drying effect.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 11 at 12:13PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Risk for river ice formation and ice jams increasing late this weekend through next week... Favorable conditions for river ice development and possible ice jams are expected to move into the area by late this weekend, impacting the Rock, Fox, and Kishwaukee river basins. This risk will begin on Sunday and is expected to continue through next week.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 11:24AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Extended Arctic Cold Snap Coming.... Arctic air will soon begin spreading into the region as we head into the holiday weekend. This will eventually help change rain over to some brief light snow in some places just before it ends, and it will offer sub freezing air for any moisture that lingers despite the wind`s drying effect.
